title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Very good experience. A lot to learn and grow. Perfect job for people person. I enjoyed my time and helped patients with their questions. Good managers and bosses. Overall, 5 star experience
Interview Questions: Why you want to join the team?

title: PTA Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview went very well, two very nice gentlemen interviewed me. Made me feel comfortable during the whole process and it was online which was nice being able to squeeze in an interview with my current job.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience and all of the types of patients I have been exposed to in my career

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: It was two rounds with Principle investigator. Then followed by a meet and greet with lab mates. Also, they cross questions and asked me If I have any questions to ask
Interview Questions: About the experiment setup and standardization

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Very slow, took forever not enough communication, posting not correct. Interview very short.  Couldn’t hear the panel, not good service.  Neve receives a email with a decision. Hopefully things will change in the near future
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weakness

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was conversational and pleasant. There were some common HR questions that were asked. Supplemented answers with stories and had time to ask questions at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals?

title: Software Systems Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Process took a week. 

The interview was 1 1/2 hour long with a panel of 5 interviewer. 

Standard DotNet and SQL questions which we can find in the multiple blogs.

Some SQL query writing questions. 
And 1 C# generics code validation/explain code question
Interview Questions:
Oops concepts
SQL indexes
Entity Framework
Serialization
Async 
Tasks

title: Accounts Payable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (League City, TX) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Did a phone interview first, and then afterwards I was invited to do a virtual interview through Microsoft teams with supervisor and manager. They allowed me to ask questions towards the end of the interview and gave great feedback.
Interview Questions: What are some skills and/or qualities that make you fit for this specific role? How do you handle repetitive work?

title: Wellness Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Average and mainly behavioral questions. Why do you want to work for UTMB? Talk about your resume more in depth. Are you comfortable speaking to large groups? Are you a team player?
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UTMB?

title: Nurse Clinician III Outpatient (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Gatesville, TX) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact via email and interview was scheduled telephonically.  Arrived and was escorted to the interview panel office area. Introductions and process initiated. Conversation flowed well, structure was comfortable and interview panel was interested and engaging.
Interview Questions: Experiences in dealing with conflict.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy interview process, normal questions involving hypothetical scenarios. Asking about strengths and weaknesses as well as a time where you may have been in a difficult position and how you handled it.
Interview Questions: What does being a patient advocate mean to you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: it was very quick an d prompt. person was dquick to be done with inteview. Was confused about diversity and equal pay. Wished that I  studied more about the culture
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Junior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
several calls, several steps to pass, it was too much, but they were friendly. 
the first step was the HR call
the second one was with a manager 
the third was with another manager who asked me some simple questions about programing definition...
and then there were two other steps for deeper technical questions
Interview Questions: some technical questions about general programing knowledge

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Recieved a phone from hiring manager within 1 month of applying online. The call lasted 5- 10 minutes. Basic questions such as 5 year plan and my past experience. I had the opportunity to ask questions and was given a contact number if I had any further questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Houston, TX) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted through email. Given a zoom link to join a call. Then given a timeframe to one to start if I got accepted. He then told me what was required of the job.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Training Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions:
I've chosen to review here because they have provided no information or feedback to close out the process- now 26 days following the interview. 

The interview was via MS Teams with several of the training team members. I was asked to prepare and conduct a 10 minute presentation for the interview to be given following a series of questions. 

The interview was a combination of  skills-based and behavioral questions about how I would react to situations in addition to my experience with certain tools and activities. 

Ghosting a candidate is unacceptable following a f/f  meeting (although it was electronic) particularly one that you have asked a person to do ACTUAL work to prepare for.  

The meeting was fine (it turned out to be working in a particular system I don't have interest in working in) but I am quite certain that I've dodged a bullet.
Interview Questions: Please prepare a 10 minute presentation

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with the hiring manager and a few people from various departments who held leadership positions.  It was a one interview process. You do not have to interview with HR first.
Interview Questions: Typical situational interview questions in group format.

title: Patient Service Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: The interview started on time, and they asked the standard interview questions that any other job would ask.  It was a panel of two people, usually more due to the busy work load.
Interview Questions: If my availiablity was open.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process wasn’t intimidating at all. All of the interviewers were very welcoming and engaged in conversation making me comfortable. Don’t overthink anything before going in, you got this!
Interview Questions: They asked me to select a patient and I had to describe how I’d take care of them (possible meds, tests, vitals, labs, etc.)

title: Interview Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Quick (less than thirty minutes). There were two separate interviews with small conversations. Used sdn for tips and preparation. Each question they asked was on the sdn page. Good luck
Interview Questions: What is a book that you read lately?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was very friendly and knowledgeable . She was able to answer all of my questions around shifts, locations, as well as benefits and culture. She was able to schedule an interview time that fit my needs.
Interview Questions: I particularly liked the questions around team work because that was important to me.

title: Infant Hearing Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Very simple process. Not intense. Personality based and wants to know why you want the job within the audiology department. Even if it is to help further along other career paths you may have.
Interview Questions: Why do I want the job?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Dallas, TX) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Questions concerning blood draws and order of draw. Will also ask about your availability as well as your background in the field. Strengths/weaknesses and how you are in the workplace.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, but professional, very welcoming, to the point. They work around your schedule with in person or zoom interviews. Give you time to ask questions, explained benefits well.
Interview Questions: What are my strengths

title: Peer Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview for this position. You get chosen by your grades and then decide if you would like to tutor or not.  It was through email and all sessions are done online through Teams
Interview Questions: They asked if I wanted to tutor?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed via skype in front of a group. All questions were related to personal work history and career goals. Little information was given about the position, start date, expectations for employment, or benefits offered by the company. The entire interview lasted about thirty minutes.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest downfall as an employee?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied on website and phone interview; was set up for interviews with a department;  due to COVID 19 via skype; very pleasant doctors and faculty; made the process smooth and made me feel comfortable during interviews.  There was a combination of skype and phone interviews.  I have no complaints other than I am still pending, likely due to the COVID 19 changes
Interview Questions: What was the reason for leaving your current position?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: get a phone interview one month after applying for the position. then get an invitation of onsite interview three month after the phone interview. introduced the department and working environment and then asked some questions.
Interview Questions: introduce yourself.

title: SLP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position of SLP resident. The interview process is an all day experience, in which you interview with all of the SLPs on staff throughout the day. I had 8 interviews in all throughout my time with them on the day of the interview.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were mostly behavioral vs clinical, although they did ask some very specific clinical questions.

title: Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with an outside consultant who had been hired to re-establish the interpretation department.  New interpreters, managers and staff were being considered for the new program to be developed.
Interview Questions: Experience interpreting

title: Desktop Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Webster, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I Interviewed with two supervisors over the teams i woukd be working with. I took a short written test before the one on one questions.  The interview was in their office.
Interview Questions: What is one if your weaknesses?

title: Busineess Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed and had the most experience at of all the candidates but didn't get the job because I didn't know the particular software so I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: What makes your the best qualified candidate

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Skype, panel interview. Asked about 3 reasons why I wanted the position. They asked what made me a great fit. They asked scenario-type questions. They answered questions at the end.
Interview Questions: What are three reasons you want to intern here?

title: Mental Health Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Gatesville, TX) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got interview invite emails. I waited in the hallway until my name was called for both interviews( did 2 in one day). Both were panel interviews by two interviewers rotating asking questions.  At the end of the first interview, one of them said “ the answers to these questions you basically learn on the job” which I thought was unwarranted and if true makes me think these interviews are unjustly biased towards a certain type of candidate, not me.
Interview Questions: What goes into a mental status exam?

title: Pharmacy Technologists Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick they needed techs really bad and I've been applying for a while and finally got a call from a recruiter.the recruiter interviewed and then sent my paperwork to manager and they set me up an additional interview.
Interview Questions: why Do you feel you a qualified to work for utmb?

title: Buyer 1 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Houston, TX) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied on a job board. I scheduled an in person interview via email. I showed up and was interviewed by four people. They asked questions about my resume and background.
Interview Questions: Was asked questions about background

title: Traditional BSN Program Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: After applying, received an email about scheduling an interview, and details about where the interview would be. A little over a month after the interview, received an email about conditional acceptance.
Interview Questions: Tell me about why you want to be in this program

title: PSS Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Filled out online application and got a call to come in 2 months later with the manager of clinic and nursing side. Interview lasted about 1 hour. They went off a sheet of typical questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict in the work place?

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: 2 part interview process that involved a phone screen and in-person meeting. After the phone screen, there was a personality test and a drug test.  The in-person meeting was unstructured.
Interview Questions: Q: What do you see your career in 10 years from now?

title: Purchasing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter contacts you and sets you up to interview with manager . Met with manager and we talked for an hour.  He liked my skills and made an offer within 1 day.  I accepted. Started a few weeks later. Lots of paperwork and orientation. I have nothing else to really submit other than that. But I haven’t quite made it to 30 worlds yet so until I do then I will be writing complete nonsense.
Interview Questions: What yours strength?

title: Mental Health Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Rosharon, TX) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was 2-3 weeks after applying. 5 to 10 preset open ended questions from a panel on site. A bit confusing on how to get in the building (heavy security). Then upon approval, drug test, background check, and security clearance took 2-3 months.
Interview Questions: Would you be comfortable facilitating classes and groups on mental health?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (League City, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward for a government position, ten questions, mix of general and situational questions, panel of three people for most professional titles, lengthy response or offer time after interview, panelists may or may not be from the hiring department, panelists must write everything down
Interview Questions: What are three strengths and three weaknesses?

title: IS Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions:
Questionaire
First round interview with a few committee members
Second round interview with entire committee 

Pretty intense if not properly prepared. Over 10 questions per in-person interview. Took about 3-4 weeks for official offer.
Interview Questions: Basic Interview Questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was refereed through a former employee. My nursing manager was really nice, and informative. The nurse manager really gave me a pep talk about surviving as a nurse. I am so grateful for this opportunity!
Interview Questions: What are you plans in the next 6 months?

title: Radiologic Technologist (RT) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone.  I was called in for an interview which consisted of 21 questions some basic interview questions, some X-ray and technical questions which caught me off guard.
Interview Questions: What's the best view for maxillary sinuses?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Director and interviewer made me feel at ease . They walked me through a typical day on each unit I interacted with all levels of staff and toured the facility
Interview Questions: How I would deal with a conflict with another employee

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Houston, TX) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very odd, 1 manager talked most of the interview about everything but the position, though once we got into real questions with other managers, I felt as if I nailed it, only to find out I was passed over because I was NOT bi-lingual, even though the position did not require it. Very disappointing as several positions were open and avail to be filled.
Interview Questions: How did I feel about working with a diverse group (obvious an 'assessment' question)

title: TDCJ Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Houston, TX) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Good nice people good place to work , good pay,  great hr department and they do really good at training, free food and drinks always there to help you great place
Interview Questions: What make me want to be a co

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy, comfortable and respectful.  The staff was very friendly and the questions were relevant to my position.  Felt at home immediately.  No nerves.  Everyone was kind and open.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with a panel of 7 members.  VP, 4 directors, a manager and the Sr. Financial Analyst.  The interview lasted about an hour and consisted of each member discussing their position and background and how it related to the job.  I then provided my background and how it related to the position
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Mental Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. You need to know your stuff. The interview itself is not difficult as long as you know what you are talking about. The interview was very through and the panelists told me exactly what they were looking for.
Interview Questions: What are they symptoms of MDD without psychotic features?

title: PACU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line and was given a time and date to be interviewed.  At the interview I waited to be called to see 3 different dept. heads and was asked the same questions for 3 different jobs.
Interview Questions: tell us of a time when you may have said or done something you regettted later involving a co-worker

title: Budget & Analysis Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions:
First round interview at the campus, consisted of two interviewers 
second round interview was held in galveston, Tx had a panel interview with 7 UTMB budget and analysis team management 
Found out a week later that they had selected me
Interview Questions: what are your strengths

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews were required.  First one was a panel interview with a few department employees.  The 2nd interview contained all members of the department.  In each interview, various questions were asked.  The 2nd interview was mainly a test to see how well I would fit in the department and the various members asked me questions.
Interview Questions: How quickly could I learn a new industry (Medical)?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Brief, concise. Job requirements and expectations clearly outlined. Compensation and schedule explained in detail. Staff encourages questions about travel and job requirements. Works hard to accommodate job location requests.
Interview Questions: Are you dependable

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Very detailed interview process. Day long itinerary complete with peers, physician & administrative leaders
There had been considerable time between phone screening interview & day-long interview event. 
Challenge was to have relavent questions for 8 different interview sections, some 1on1 & others w/ 4-6 people. 
Department decided to cancel the position posting.  Has not been re-posted.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you instead of another candidate?

title: HUC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Proficient face to face, what was expected from the candidate selected. If I had preference for any shift.
My desire to work with a united group for one purpose to be in care of patients.
Interview Questions: Shift of interest, I mentioned day or evening.  My mistake. Prefer day.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Huntsville, TX)
Interview Descriptions: you have to go through a extensive back ground process. Was ask lots of questions about how to handle different and difficult situations. Education possessed to able for position.
Interview Questions: How you felt about working in the confines of a Prison.

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Pasadena, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was a group interview (former manager, health provider and upcoming new director) in person in the education room of the clinic.  The second interview was through tele health with the regional director in another city.  I applied on-line, finding it through Indeed, and followed up with a phone call and in person (dropping off my short resume to the person in charge).  I also found that an HR rep was connected to my career resource development director at my alum so I asked her to connect me, which connected us to the right HR person.  This took about a month and then I got called in for an interview, which was followed by another about 2 weeks later.  The offer came about 2-3 weeks after that (a little longer than anticipated) and then I began the negotiation.  Salary negotiation took about 1 week or so and then I did the drug/screen tests.  I started about 2-3 weeks after the salary was negotiated, which was not able to be moved much, even though a range had been publicly advertised.
Interview Questions: Asked questions about handling multiple challenges. How would I handle most of the front desk staff calling in sick, for example or a patient yelling at me?  How did I feel about not working in a glamorous environment?  They were clear of the many challenges and demands on the position and asked about my attention to detail, ability to do reports and meet demands.

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They were all very nice. I couldn't accept the position because it intervened with my school orientation. Overall it was a nice experience. They work as a team and expect the same for prospective employees.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Postdoctorol Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was telephonic interview first followed by onsite interview. On the day of the interview, I was picked up in the morning and then had one on one interview with five people from the different departments.
Interview Questions: why I want to switch my field from plant science to human pathogen.

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The manager I interviewed with was a fine man, and the interview was very pleasant. I could tell after a short while that this was not the position I desired, but I learned from the interview.
Interview Questions: Do you understand and can manipulate Excel pivot tables efficiently?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of firstly getting a call back from management; having your CRT/RRT and necessary certifications (BLS/ACLS/PALS/NRP) is a vital aspect of getting hired on. The interview was a panel interview of six department leads. During the interivew basic questions were asked, none in which pertained directly to the job title.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult and/or unexpected questions. All were straight forward and manageable to answer even if you had no previous work experience.

title: Clerk/Typist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was conducted very well I thought. My employer was a very warm and intelligent person and I felt I was being listened to. The interview went well also with all of the employees in the office in attendance.
Interview Questions: What is expected of you without knowing your job specifically.

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Webster, TX)
Interview Descriptions: HR email / HR phone call / On site interview with management / On site interview with team members
Interview Questions: Interview with management was lengthy, very positive, and went well. Was surprised by subsequent interview with team members as they asked questions about specific qualifications/experience not listed in the job posting or brought up by HR or IT management.

title: Clerk II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: You go to the first interview, they ask question related to the position, if they are interested they call you for a second interview, at the second interview they discuss benefits, pay rate and if you accept it's yours if not they proceed to interview some other candidates.
Interview Questions: None where difficult, because when you have a good work ethics even the question: tell me a difficult situation at work should be answered without find it so difficult.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: panel interview, Managed financial matters such as budget analysis and financial reports. Reconciled and conducted in depth analysis of all expenses to ensure they matched the ledger and ensured all expenses were allowable under the grant. Prepared final, annual, and quarterly financial reports to be submitted to sponsors. Used TOAD to collect information for financial analysis.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Senior Applications Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed atmosphere with a formulaic interview with three people. UTMB tends to have pre-written interview questions. Job titles are very generic and do not always reflect job responsibilities. Rather, they match the salary level that the position can pay.
Interview Questions: A few questions based on skill set. A few questions based on customer service. Relaxed banter. Opportunity to control the interview flow. Managers sometimes have no clue about the skill topics they are interviewing about.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Single phone screen with senior developer, operations manager, department vice president. Technical questions were all focused on technology experience, such as "Do you have experience with x framework?" or "How long have you developed with x library?"
Interview Questions: None of the questions were difficult.

title: Student - Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Very laid back. My manager asked typical questions: when was a time you worked well indecently, as a team etc. 
I was offered the position at the interview. Be sure to dress professionally. Try to arrive early, especially if you are not familiar with the hospital.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you worked well independently?

title: Clinical Correctional Associate (CCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Rosharon, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with unit leadership and was called that day. Don't take your phone on the unit - they will make you go back to your car to put it up. Don't wear anything flashy, you are going to a prison.  Don't let the environment overwhelm you.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about dealing with difficult patients.

title: Health Unit Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 10 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Took almost a year to get an interview and then I was interviewed for a shift and position I didn't apply for. Group interview was with my future pears and a manager. Very quick, easy, and informal. The entire interview took less than 20 minutes. Who they choose to interview you is based on who is willing and available at the time. Could be a nurse, a tech, anyone. They did my validate parking. I felt very comfortable, however, I was very confident in my abilities for filling the position based on my personality and experience.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflicts with co-workers?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume on UTMB's website and filled out their online Profile Information, which is similar to an online resume.  A few weeks later, HR contacted me for an interview.  They gave me the names of the people I would be interviewing with.  The interviewers made me feel very comfortable and at ease.  About 1 week later, I received a call that they wanted me to interview with the staff and the person I would be assisting.  About 1 week after that, I received a phone call from HR notifying me that I did not get the position.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were standard questions, but when you want something so bad, it seems a little intimidating.  It was a good process to go through, which will help me with future interviews.

title: Inpatient Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The first initial contact came from the HR department.  A pharmacy manager will contact you to set up an interview date.  On the day of the interview, you will be interviewed by each of the three managers separately.  You should expect to hear back from one of the pharmacy managers if you have received an offer.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were pretty standard for behavioral questions as well as personality questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was detailed and concise.  They gave you lots of instructions and ensured that you knew when to show up and where.  Good follow ups with emails, excellent communications on what to expect.  I had a panel interview which so there were more questions than usual, but everyone was respectful, polite and supportive.  Panel was 4 members.
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from other candidates?

title: Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed  with hiring manager, then team leads and was called within 1 week. What takes longer is the background check. The salaries are based on experience. It's hard to advance within, especially if you wish to go up. Overall, the benefits are great and their health insurance is really good. ,
Interview Questions: What software are you advanced in?

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Temp agency called me in to start a new job. I interviewed with the company on a Thursday and they wanted to start that Monday.  I was interviewed by dept administrator and then the director.
Interview Questions: None

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: Day-long interview with faculty and chair of department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch
Interview Descriptions: I joined UTMB as a postdoc. The interview process was easy-presentation followed by meeting with people from the department
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very lengthy and involved multiple interviews:  Human Resources, a group formed of my future customers, and the hiring manager.  The total timeline took more than 3 months.
Interview Questions: What is you strength?

title: Phlebotomist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Houston, TX) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with supervisor within prison setting, assistant called 2 weeks later for drug testing (48 hours to accomplish regardless of other employment) 2 weeks later called and advised of start date. Training to be held 60+ miles away. Process extremely long from application to hire. Applied in October, started in February. That includes hiring process and 2 weeks notice to current job.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Vice Chair Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, drug testing, background check.
Interview Questions: Depending on how desperate and needy a department is to hire someone for a position that will be reporting and serving several departments.  The questions might be standard and simple.

title: Audit Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through my college's career center website. I was asked the standard behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: It was about career change, the question was expected, i felt like i wasn't prepared to be grilled on it.

title: Physician Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Ridiculous long drawn out have to go take another typing test at the Unemployment office in order to get a low paying job.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last job. Stupid question.

title: Gérant/Conseiller En Investissement Financier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (San Antonio, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted by two people.  Each person had a list of questions.  As I answered the interview question, my answer was documented.  The interviewers took turns asking the questions.  They were both very nice and knowledgeable about daily work responsibilities.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Mental Health Clinician and Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Tennessee Colony, TX) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough interview of mental health background and knowledge pertinent to Mental Health Clinician and Psychologist. Interview covered knowledge pertinent to function as a Clinical Psychology with a special population.
Interview Questions: Fully describe what's involved in a mental health assessment

title: Lab Liaison Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy.  I had to go to several interviews over the course of several months and it was a long process, but not any longer than any other company.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation where you were involved in making a process change for the company that resulted in a better situation?

title: Gérant/Conseiller En Investissement Financier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the head nurse and the practice manager I was asked about my background experience how well I work with others could I follow instructions was I willing to do overtime and I would be on a two trial period.
Interview Questions: was I scared to work in a jail setting being lock in for 8 hours  more a day couldn't really answer that question because I had never worked in a prison system before

title: Research Scientist I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I have emailed to a professor doing research of my interest. Got an interview call, they looked at my previous research experience and we share some common interests, they hired
Interview Questions: Salary negotiation

title: Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Marlin, TX) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: utmb human resource representative within the prison unit contacts to schedule interview.  Once the date is set you will be interviewed by a psych nurse, and two staff members.  The applicant will be asked several behavioral questions related to situations such as team-work and handling difficult situations.  At this point, you will be given a tour by the manager and thanked for taking the time to complete the interview process.  Different units implement different questions.  One might be asked to define several terms, another unit may ask to provide 3 possible diagnosis for different patient diagnostic situations.  Given a tour of the facility, and thanked for participating.
Interview Questions: A situation arises between two prisoners that might degrade into violence; how do you handle the situation.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The University of Texas Medical Branch (Galveston, TX) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Took a while for the administrative process to finish.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UTMB
